required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Study Of SU011248 In Combination With Docetaxel In Patients With Metastatic Breast Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Exploratory Evaluation Of A Sequential Administration Of Docetaxel And SU011248 In Women With Advanced Breast Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: This study is to evaluate the safety of SU011248 (Sunitinib/Sutent) in combination with docetaxel in patients with metastatic or locally recurrent breast cancer who have not received chemotherapy treatment in the advanced disease setting.

primary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time Zero (0) to 24 Hours (AUC24): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
Trough Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) at Time Zero (0): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Docetaxel PK Parameters
Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax): Docetaxel PK Parameters
Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero (0) to 24 Hours (AUC24): Docetaxel PK Parameters
Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve From Time Zero (0) to 48 Hours (AUC48): Docetaxel PK Parameters
Area Under the Curve From Time 24 Hours to 48 Hours (AUC24_48) : Docetaxel PK Parameters
Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast): Docetaxel PK Parameters
Plasma Elimination Half-life (t1/2): Docetaxel PK Parameters

secondary_outcome.measure: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Based on Investigator Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until progressive disease

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Objective Response of Complete Response or Partial Response Based on Investigator Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until at least 4 weeks after confirmed response or partial response

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Subjects With Clinical Benefit of Complete Response, Partial Response, or Stable Disease Based on Investigator Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until at least 24 weeks on study

secondary_outcome.measure: Duration of Tumor Response Based on Investigator Assessment
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Start of first confirmed CR or PR to first confirmed progression or death

intervention.description: Sunitinib (Sutent) 37.5 mg in schedule 2/1; Sunitinib (Sutent) 37.5 mg in continuous dosing (post discontinuation of axotere) and in accordance with Investigator decision
Taxotere 75 mg/m2 iv, once every 3 weeks

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Breast cancer with evidence of unresectable, locally recurrent or metastatic disease
- Candidate for treatment with docetaxel
Exclusion Criteria:
- Prior chemotherapy in the advanced disease setting
- Inflammatory breast cancer
- HER2 positive disease

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: First 12 subjects evaluable for pharmacokinetic (PK) analysis had full PK profile on Cycle 1, Day 1 (C1D1) and C2D1.

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

participants_list.participants: Subject End of Study=Completed; not per protocol reason. PI reason=withdrawn during active treatment

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

outcome.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
outcome.description: Median Tmax = time for maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation.
outcome.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis is subjects in ITT population who completed sampling for PK profiles for both SU011248 and docetaxel; ITT population = all subjects enrolled in study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (SU011248 or docetaxel).

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
measure.description: Median Tmax = time for maximum plasma concentration (Cmax) for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation.
measure.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis is subjects in ITT population who completed sampling for PK profiles for both SU011248 and docetaxel; ITT population = all subjects enrolled in study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (SU011248 or docetaxel).

outcome.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
outcome.description: Mean Cmax = maximum plasma concentration for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug) measured as nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation; Cmax dose corrected C2D3 (dose correction if predose concentrations of SU011248 or SU012662 were > 5% of Cmax).
outcome.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Maximum Observed Plasma Concentration (Cmax): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
measure.description: Mean Cmax = maximum plasma concentration for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug) measured as nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation; Cmax dose corrected C2D3 (dose correction if predose concentrations of SU011248 or SU012662 were > 5% of Cmax).
measure.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

analysis.groups_desc: SU011248 C1D2 vs C2D3. Due to the exploratory nature of the study, no statistical hypothesis testing was done since the primary purpose was to assess the tolerability of the combination of SU011248 with docetaxel.
analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.
Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.
Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.

outcome.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time Zero (0) to 24 Hours (AUC24): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
outcome.description: Mean AUC24 = area under plasma concentration-time profile from time 0 to 24 hours for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug) measured in nanograms times hour per milliliter (ng*hr/mL); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation; AUC24 dose corrected C2D3 (dose correction if predose concentrations of SU011248 or SU012662 were > 5% of Cmax).
outcome.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Profile From Time Zero (0) to 24 Hours (AUC24): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
measure.description: Mean AUC24 = area under plasma concentration-time profile from time 0 to 24 hours for SU011248, SU012662, and combined SU011248 and SU012662 (total drug) measured in nanograms times hour per milliliter (ng*hr/mL); collected C1D2, C2D3. Paired observation; AUC24 dose corrected C2D3 (dose correction if predose concentrations of SU011248 or SU012662 were > 5% of Cmax).
measure.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

analysis.estimate_desc: Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.
Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.
Ratio percent (%) (Test/Reference) of adjusted geometric means; values have been back-transformed from the log scale.

outcome.title: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
outcome.description: Mean AUClast = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time 0 (predose) to the last measurable concentration; collected C1D2, C2D3. Data did not allow calculation of AUClast; not summarized; AUC summarized in outcome measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero (0) to 24 hours (AUC24): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters.
outcome.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Area Under the Curve From Time 0 to Last Quantifiable Concentration (AUClast): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
measure.description: Mean AUClast = area under the plasma concentration-time profile from time 0 (predose) to the last measurable concentration; collected C1D2, C2D3. Data did not allow calculation of AUClast; not summarized; AUC summarized in outcome measure: Area under the plasma concentration-time curve from time zero (0) to 24 hours (AUC24): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters.
measure.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis

outcome.title: Trough Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) at Time Zero (0): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
outcome.description: Mean Ctrough=plasma concentration-time profile at time 0 (predose); collected C1D2, C1D15, and C2D1. Calculated by setting concentration values below the limit of quantification to zero.
outcome.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis; (n) = Number of observations above lower limit of quantification (NALQ). No participants analyzed for SU011248 C1D2 and SU012662 C1D2; standard deviation for Total drug C1D2 confirmed as 0.00 (median, minimum, and maximum = 0.20).

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Trough Plasma Concentration (Ctrough) at Time Zero (0): Sunitinib (SU011248), Sunitinib Metabolite (SU012662), and Total Drug PK Parameters
measure.description: Mean Ctrough=plasma concentration-time profile at time 0 (predose); collected C1D2, C1D15, and C2D1. Calculated by setting concentration values below the limit of quantification to zero.
measure.population: Evaluable set of subjects for PK analysis; (n) = Number of observations above lower limit of quantification (NALQ). No participants analyzed for SU011248 C1D2 and SU012662 C1D2; standard deviation for Total drug C1D2 confirmed as 0.00 (median, minimum, and maximum = 0.20).

outcome.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Based on Investigator Assessment
outcome.description: Median time (50 percent [%]) from the first dose of study treatment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first; based on Investigator assessment. PFS calculated as (Weeks) = (first event date minus first dose date plus 1) divided by 7.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until progressive disease
outcome.population: ITT population = all subjects enrolled in study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (SU011248 or docetaxel).

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Progression-Free Survival (PFS) Based on Investigator Assessment
measure.description: Median time (50 percent [%]) from the first dose of study treatment to the first documentation of objective tumor progression or to death due to any cause, whichever occurs first; based on Investigator assessment. PFS calculated as (Weeks) = (first event date minus first dose date plus 1) divided by 7.
measure.population: ITT population = all subjects enrolled in study who received at least 1 dose of study medication (SU011248 or docetaxel).

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Objective Response of Complete Response or Partial Response Based on Investigator Assessment
outcome.description: Number of subjects with objective response based on Investigator assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until at least 4 weeks after confirmed response or partial response

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Objective Response of Complete Response or Partial Response Based on Investigator Assessment
measure.description: Number of subjects with objective response based on Investigator assessment of confirmed complete response (CR) or confirmed partial response (PR) according to Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors (RECIST). Confirmed responses are those that persist on repeat imaging study at least 4 weeks after initial documentation of response.

analysis.groups_desc: Overall confirmed objective response rate (CR + PR)
analysis.estimate_desc: Two-sided Confidence Interval (CI) (%) from exact method based on F distribution.

outcome.title: Number of Subjects With Clinical Benefit of Complete Response, Partial Response, or Stable Disease Based on Investigator Assessment
outcome.description: Number of subjects with clinical benefit based on Investigator assessment of confirmed complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) according to RECIST for at least 24 weeks on study.
outcome.time_frame: First dose of study treatment until at least 24 weeks on study

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Number of Subjects With Clinical Benefit of Complete Response, Partial Response, or Stable Disease Based on Investigator Assessment
measure.description: Number of subjects with clinical benefit based on Investigator assessment of confirmed complete response (CR), partial response (PR), or stable disease (SD) according to RECIST for at least 24 weeks on study.

analysis.groups_desc: Clinical Benefit Rate (CR + PR + SD > = 24 weeks)
analysis.estimate_desc: Two-sided CI (%) from exact method based on F distribution.

outcome.title: Duration of Tumor Response Based on Investigator Assessment
outcome.description: Median duration (50%) of tumor response based on Investigator assessment for a subgroup of subjects with objective disease response: who have not progressed or died due to any cause; with a response and subsequent progression or death due to any cause for duration of response (DR). DR defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response (CR or PR) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.
outcome.time_frame: Start of first confirmed CR or PR to first confirmed progression or death
outcome.population: ITT; subgroup of subjects with objective disease response

group.title: Sunitinib in Combination With Docetaxel
group.description: Sunitinib (SU011248) orally (PO) for 2 weeks every 3 weeks (2 weeks on, then 1 week off = Schedule 2/1) starting on Day 2 (Cycle 2, Day 3 only for those subjects included in the Pharmacokinetic [PK] study); starting dose 37.5 milligrams (mg) daily (QD). Docetaxel (Taxotere) administered Day 1 of each cycle via intravenous (IV) infusion every 3 weeks; starting dose 75 mg/m2.

measure.title: Duration of Tumor Response Based on Investigator Assessment
measure.description: Median duration (50%) of tumor response based on Investigator assessment for a subgroup of subjects with objective disease response: who have not progressed or died due to any cause; with a response and subsequent progression or death due to any cause for duration of response (DR). DR defined as time from start of first documented objective tumor response (CR or PR) to first documented objective tumor progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. DR calculated as (Weeks) = (the end date for DR minus first subsequent confirmed CR or PR plus 1) divided by 7.
measure.population: ITT; subgroup of subjects with objective disease response

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
